panels.description: Major and minor garbage collections

targets.expr:
label_replace(
  avg by (job, action, cause) (
  rate(jvm_gc_pause_seconds_sum{job!="",job=~"$job",instance=~"$instance"}[$__rate_interval])
  /
  rate(jvm_gc_pause_seconds_count{job!="",job=~"$job",instance=~"$instance"}[$__rate_interval])
)

, "action", "$1", "action", "end of (.+)")

panels.title: GC duration

panels.description:
'Allocated' is the size increase of the young generation memory pool after one GC and before the next. It reflects minor GC.
'Promoted' is the size increase of the old generation memory pool after GC. It reflects full GC.
panels.title: Allocated/promoted

panels.description: The current number of live threads including both daemon and non-daemon threads.
panels.title: Threads

panels.description: Threads by current state.
panels.title: Threads states

panels.description: Direct buffer is allocated outside the Java heap and represents the OS native memory used by the JVM process. It is generally used for I/O operations. Note that direct buffers aren't freed up by GC.
panels.title: Direct buffer used bytes

panels.description: The mapped buffer pool is used for its FileChannel instances.
panels.title: Mapped buffer used
